title: Project-Based Learning to Improve Academic Achievement Through Motivation Regulation Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science knowledge and comprehension of learning strategies
context.additional_context: Structured Self-Regulation Strategy Application for Science Majors/General Education Students to Improve Cognitive Learning and Academic Achievement

learning_goals: Learners apply three motivation regulation strategies (MRSs: e.g., goal setting, self-reward, feedback utilization) to create a six-month learning plan and submit monthly progress reports (≥80% completion rate, ≥2 strategy application cases).

Over six months, learners solve problems in three project-based assignments (4–5 members per team) by applying cognitive learning strategies (metacognition, concept mapping, case comparison analysis) and ensure final outputs (reports/presentations) achieve ≥3 points per category (≥9/12 total) on a rubric (problem definition clarity, strategy appropriateness, action plan specificity, outcome effectiveness).

Learners improve their final GPA by ≥0.3 points over six months by setting weekly study plans (using time management matrices), course-specific GPA goals, writing weekly learning journals, and incorporating advisor feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
